required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between Minimum Inhibitory Concentration and Clinical Outcome of Invasive Fusariosis
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation Between Minimum Inhibitory Concentration and Clinical Outcome of Invasive Fusariosis

lead_sponsor.agency: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

clinical_study.source: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

brief_summary.textblock: Multi-centered, international, observational and retrospective study to analyze the correlation between MIC and clinical outcome in patients with invasive fusariosis.

arm_group.description: Patients hospitalized with an invasive fusariosis diagnostic in the stablished period of study.

intervention.intervention_name: There is no intervention. This is an observational study.
intervention.description: There is no intervention. This is an observational study.

study_pop.textblock: Hospital patients diagnosed with invasive fusariosis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Invasive fusariosis diagnostic
- Proof of anti-fungic susceptibility according to EUCAST or CLSI, for the medicine used in the treatment of invasive fusariosis.
- Available data about anti-fungic medicines used: name of medicine, start and end date of treatment.
- Available information about clinical outcome of illness after 30 days, 6 weeks and 90 days (dead or alive).
- Only cases of invasive fusariosis proven or possible will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

link.description: Link to article with the results of the whole trial.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared after the study concludes and results are published.
